013package org.apache.juneau;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.ThrowableUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
017
018import java.io.*;
019import java.util.*;
020import java.util.function.*;
021
022import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.json.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.parser.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.reflect.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.swap.*;
030
031/**
032 * Java bean wrapper class.
033 *
034 * <h5 class='topic'>Description</h5>
035 *
036 * A wrapper that wraps Java bean instances inside of a {@link Map} interface that allows properties on the wrapped
037 * object can be accessed using the {@link Map#get(Object) get()} and {@link Map#put(Object,Object) put()} methods.
038 *
039 * <p>
040 * Use the {@link BeanContext} class to create instances of this class.
041 *
042 * <h5 class='topic'>Bean property order</h5>
043 *
044 * The order of the properties returned by the {@link Map#keySet() keySet()} and {@link Map#entrySet() entrySet()}
045 * methods are as follows:
046 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
047 *    <li>
048 *       If {@link Bean @Bean} annotation is specified on class, then the order is the same as the list of properties
049 *       in the annotation.
050 *    <li>
051 *       If {@link Bean @Bean} annotation is not specified on the class, then the order is the same as that returned
052 *       by the {@link java.beans.BeanInfo} class (i.e. ordered by definition in the class).
053 * </ul>
054 *
055 * <h5 class='topic'>POJO swaps</h5>
056 *
057 * If {@link ObjectSwap ObjectSwaps} are defined on the class types of the properties of this bean or the bean properties
058 * themselves, the {@link #get(Object)} and {@link #put(String, Object)} methods will automatically transform the
059 * property value to and from the serialized form.
060 *
061 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
062
063 * </ul>
064 *
065 * @param <T> Specifies the type of object that this map encapsulates.
066 */
067public class BeanMap<T> extends AbstractMap<String,Object> implements Delegate<T> {
068
069   /** The wrapped object. */
070   protected T bean;
071
072   /** Temporary holding cache for beans with read-only properties.  Normally null. */
073   protected Map<String,Object> propertyCache;
074
075   /** Temporary holding cache for bean properties of array types when the add() method is being used. */
076   protected Map<String,List<?>> arrayPropertyCache;
077
078   /** The BeanMeta associated with the class of the object. */
079   protected BeanMeta<T> meta;
080
081   private final BeanSession session;
082   private final String typePropertyName;
083
084   /**
085    * Convenience method for wrapping a bean inside a {@link BeanMap}.
086    *
087    * @param <T> The bean type.
088    * @param bean The bean being wrapped.
089    * @return A new {@link BeanMap} instance wrapping the bean.
090    */
091   public static <T> BeanMap<T> of(T bean) {
092      return BeanContext.DEFAULT_SESSION.toBeanMap(bean);
093   }
094
095   /**
096    * Instance of this class are instantiated through the BeanContext class.
097    *
098    * @param session The bean session object that created this bean map.
099    * @param bean The bean to wrap inside this map.
100    * @param meta The metadata associated with the bean class.
101    */
102   protected BeanMap(BeanSession session, T bean, BeanMeta<T> meta) {
103      this.session = session;
104      this.bean = bean;
105      this.meta = meta;
106      if (meta.constructorArgs.length > 0)
107         propertyCache = new TreeMap<>();
108      this.typePropertyName = session.getBeanTypePropertyName(meta.classMeta);
109   }
110
111   /**
112    * Returns the metadata associated with this bean map.
113    *
114    * @return The metadata associated with this bean map.
115    */
116   public BeanMeta<T> getMeta() {
117      return meta;
118   }
119
120   /**
121    * Returns the bean session that created this bean map.
122    *
123    * @return The bean session that created this bean map.
124    */
125   public final BeanSession getBeanSession() {
126      return session;
127   }
128
129   /**
130    * Returns the wrapped bean object.
131    *
132    * <p>
133    * Triggers bean creation if bean has read-only properties set through a constructor defined by the
134    * {@link Beanc @Beanc} annotation.
135    *
136    * @return The inner bean object.
137    */
138   public T getBean() {
139      T b = getBean(true);
140
141      // If we have any arrays that need to be constructed, do it now.
142      if (arrayPropertyCache != null) {
143         arrayPropertyCache.forEach((k,v) -> {
144            try {
145                getPropertyMeta(k).setArray(b, v);
146            } catch (Exception e1) {
147               throw asRuntimeException(e1);
148            }
149         });
150         arrayPropertyCache = null;
151      }
152
153      // Initialize any null Optional<X> fields.
154      for (BeanPropertyMeta pMeta : this.meta.propertyArray) {
155         ClassMeta<?> cm = pMeta.getClassMeta();
156         if (cm.isOptional() && pMeta.get(this, pMeta.getName()) == null)
157            pMeta.set(this, pMeta.getName(), cm.getOptionalDefault());
158      }
159      // Do the same for hidden fields.
160      this.meta.hiddenProperties.forEach((k,v) -> {
161         ClassMeta<?> cm = v.getClassMeta();
162         if (cm.isOptional() && v.get(this, v.getName()) == null)
163            v.set(this, v.getName(), cm.getOptionalDefault());
164      });
165
166      return b;
167   }
168
169   /**
170    * Returns the wrapped bean object.
171    *
172    * <p>
173    * If <c>create</c> is <jk>false</jk>, then this method may return <jk>null</jk> if the bean has read-only
174    * properties set through a constructor defined by the {@link Beanc @Beanc} annotation.
175    *
176    * <p>
177    * This method does NOT always return the bean in it's final state.
178    * Array properties temporary stored as ArrayLists are not finalized until the {@link #getBean()} method is called.
179    *
180    * @param create If bean hasn't been instantiated yet, then instantiate it.
181    * @return The inner bean object.
182    */
183   public T getBean(boolean create) {
184      /** If this is a read-only bean, then we need to create it. */
185      if (bean == null && create && meta.constructorArgs.length > 0) {
186         String[] props = meta.constructorArgs;
187         ConstructorInfo c = meta.constructor;
188         Object[] args = new Object[props.length];
189         for (int i = 0; i < props.length; i++)
190            args[i] = propertyCache.remove(props[i]);
191         try {
192            bean = c.<T>invoke(args);
193            propertyCache.forEach((k,v) -> put(k, v));
194            propertyCache = null;
195         } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
196            throw new BeanRuntimeException(e, meta.classMeta.innerClass, "IllegalArgumentException occurred on call to class constructor ''{0}'' with argument types ''{1}''", c.getSimpleName(), Json5Serializer.DEFAULT.toString(ClassUtils.getClasses(args)));
197         } catch (Exception e) {
198            throw new BeanRuntimeException(e);
199         }
200      }
201      return bean;
202   }
203
204   /**
205    * Sets a property on the bean.
206    *
207    * <p>
208    * If there is a {@link ObjectSwap} associated with this bean property or bean property type class, then you must pass
209    * in a transformed value.
210    * For example, if the bean property type class is a {@link Date} and the bean property has the
211    * {@link org.apache.juneau.swaps.TemporalDateSwap.IsoInstant} swap associated with it through the
212    * {@link Swap#value() @Swap(value)} annotation, the value being passed in must be
213    * a String containing an ISO8601 date-time string value.
214    *
215    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
216    * <p class='bjava'>
217    *    <jc>// Construct a bean with a 'birthDate' Date field</jc>
218    *    Person <jv>person</jv> = <jk>new</jk> Person();
219    *
220    *    <jc>// Create a bean context and add the ISO8601 date-time swap</jc>
221    *    BeanContext <jv>beanContext</jv> = BeanContext.<jsm>create</jsm>().swaps(DateSwap.ISO8601DT.<jk>class</jk>).build();
222    *
223    *    <jc>// Wrap our bean in a bean map</jc>
224    *    BeanMap&lt;Person&gt; <jv>beanMap</jv> = <jv>beanContext</jv>.toBeanMap(<jv>person</jv>);
225    *
226    *    <jc>// Set the field</jc>
227    *    <jv>beanMap</jv>.put(<js>"birthDate"</js>, <js>"'1901-03-03T04:05:06-5000'"</js>);
228    * </p>
229    *
230    * @param property The name of the property to set.
231    * @param value The value to set the property to.
232    * @return
233    *    If the bean context setting {@code beanMapPutReturnsOldValue} is <jk>true</jk>, then the old value of the
234    *    property is returned.
235    *    Otherwise, this method always returns <jk>null</jk>.
236    * @throws
237    *    RuntimeException if any of the following occur.
238    *    <ul>
239    *       <li>BeanMapEntry does not exist on the underlying object.
240    *       <li>Security settings prevent access to the underlying object setter method.
241    *       <li>An exception occurred inside the setter method.
242    *    </ul>
243    */
244   @Override /* Map */
245   public Object put(String property, Object value) {
246      BeanPropertyMeta p = getPropertyMeta(property);
247      if (p == null) {
248         if (meta.ctx.isIgnoreUnknownBeanProperties() || property.equals(typePropertyName))
249            return meta.onWriteProperty(bean, property, null);
250
251         p = getPropertyMeta("*");
252         if (p == null)
253            throw new BeanRuntimeException(meta.c, "Bean property ''{0}'' not found.", property);
254      }
255      return p.set(this, property, value);
256   }
257
258   @Override /* Map */
259   public boolean containsKey(Object property) {
260      if (getPropertyMeta(emptyIfNull(property)) != null)
261         return true;
262      return super.containsKey(property);
263   }
264
265   /**
266    * Add a value to a collection or array property.
267    *
268    * <p>
269    * As a general rule, adding to arrays is not recommended since the array must be recreate each time this method is
270    * called.
271    *
272    * @param property Property name or child-element name (if {@link org.apache.juneau.xml.annotation.Xml#childName() @Xml(childName)} is specified).
273    * @param value The value to add to the collection or array.
274    */
275   public void add(String property, Object value) {
276      BeanPropertyMeta p = getPropertyMeta(property);
277      if (p == null) {
278         if (meta.ctx.isIgnoreUnknownBeanProperties())
279            return;
280         throw new BeanRuntimeException(meta.c, "Bean property ''{0}'' not found.", property);
281      }
282      p.add(this, property, value);
283   }
284
285   /**
286    * Gets a property on the bean.
287    *
288    * <p>
289    * If there is a {@link ObjectSwap} associated with this bean property or bean property type class, then this method
290    * will return the transformed value.
291    * For example, if the bean property type class is a {@link Date} and the bean property has the
292    * {@link org.apache.juneau.swaps.TemporalDateSwap.IsoInstant} swap associated with it through the
293    * {@link Swap#value() @Swap(value)} annotation, this method will return a String containing an
294    * ISO8601 date-time string value.
295    *
296    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
297    * <p class='bjava'>
298    *    <jc>// Construct a bean with a 'birthDate' Date field</jc>
299    *    Person <jv>person</jv> = <jk>new</jk> Person();
300    *    <jv>person</jv>.setBirthDate(<jk>new</jk> Date(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6));
301    *
302    *    <jc>// Create a bean context and add the ISO8601 date-time swap</jc>
303    *    BeanContext <jv>beanContext</jv> = BeanContext.<jsm>create</jsm>().swaps(DateSwap.ISO8601DT.<jk>class</jk>).build();
304    *
305    *    <jc>// Wrap our bean in a bean map</jc>
306    *    BeanMap&lt;Person&gt; <jv>beanMap</jv> = <jv>beanContext</jv>.toBeanMap(<jv>person</jv>);
307    *
308    *    <jc>// Get the field as a string (i.e. "'1901-03-03T04:05:06-5000'")</jc>
309    *    String <jv>birthDate</jv> = <jv>beanMap</jv>.get(<js>"birthDate"</js>);
310    * </p>
311    *
312    * @param property The name of the property to get.
313    * @return The property value.
314    * @throws RuntimeException if any of the following occur.
315    *    <ol>
316    *       <li>BeanMapEntry does not exist on the underlying object.
317    *       <li>Security settings prevent access to the underlying object getter method.
318    *       <li>An exception occurred inside the getter method.
319    *    </ol>
320    */
321   @Override /* Map */
322   public Object get(Object property) {
323      String pName = s(property);
324      BeanPropertyMeta p = getPropertyMeta(pName);
325      if (p == null)
326         return meta.onReadProperty(this.bean, pName, null);
327      return p.get(this, pName);
328   }
329
330   /**
331    * Same as {@link #get(Object)} but casts the value to the specific type.
332    *
333    * @param <T2> The type to cast to.
334    * @param property The name of the property to get.
335    * @param c The type to cast to.
336    * @return The property value.
337    * @throws RuntimeException if any of the following occur.
338    *    <ol>
339    *       <li>BeanMapEntry does not exist on the underlying object.
340    *       <li>Security settings prevent access to the underlying object getter method.
341    *       <li>An exception occurred inside the getter method.
342    *    </ol>
343    * @throws ClassCastException if property is not the specified type.
344    */
345   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
346   public <T2> T2 get(String property, Class<T2> c) {
347      String pName = s(property);
348      BeanPropertyMeta p = getPropertyMeta(pName);
349      if (p == null)
350         return (T2)meta.onReadProperty(this.bean, pName, null);
351      return (T2)p.get(this, pName);
352   }
353
354   /**
355    * Same as {@link #get(Object)} except bypasses the POJO filter associated with the bean property or bean filter
356    * associated with the bean class.
357    *
358    * @param property The name of the property to get.
359    * @return The raw property value.
360    */
361   public Object getRaw(Object property) {
362      String pName = s(property);
363      BeanPropertyMeta p = getPropertyMeta(pName);
364      if (p == null)
365         return null;
366      return p.getRaw(this, pName);
367   }
368
369   /**
370    * Convenience method for setting multiple property values by passing in JSON text.
371    *
372    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
373    * <p class='bjava'>
374    *    <jv>beanMap</jv>.load(<js>"{name:'John Smith',age:21}"</js>)
375    * </p>
376    *
377    * @param input The text that will get parsed into a map and then added to this map.
378    * @return This object.
379    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
380    */
381   public BeanMap<T> load(String input) throws ParseException {
382      putAll(JsonMap.ofJson(input));
383      return this;
384   }
385
386   /**
387    * Convenience method for setting multiple property values by passing in a reader.
388    *
389    * @param r The text that will get parsed into a map and then added to this map.
390    * @param p The parser to use to parse the text.
391    * @return This object.
392    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
393    * @throws IOException Thrown by <c>Reader</c>.
394    */
395   public BeanMap<T> load(Reader r, ReaderParser p) throws ParseException, IOException {
396      putAll(JsonMap.ofText(r, p));
397      return this;
398   }
399
400   /**
401    * Convenience method for loading this map with the contents of the specified map.
402    *
403    * <p>
404    * Identical to {@link #putAll(Map)} except as a fluent-style method.
405    *
406    * @param entries The map containing the entries to add to this map.
407    * @return This object.
408    */
409   @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked","rawtypes"})
410   public BeanMap<T> load(Map entries) {
411      putAll(entries);
412      return this;
413   }
414
415   /**
416    * Returns the names of all properties associated with the bean.
417    *
418    * <p>
419    * The returned set is unmodifiable.
420    */
421   @Override /* Map */
422   public Set<String> keySet() {
423      if (meta.dynaProperty == null)
424         return meta.properties.keySet();
425      Set<String> l = set();
426      meta.properties.forEach((k,v) -> {
427         if (! "*".equals(k))
428            l.add(k);
429      });
430      try {
431         l.addAll(meta.dynaProperty.getDynaMap(bean).keySet());
432      } catch (Exception e) {
433         throw new BeanRuntimeException(e);
434      }
435      return l;
436   }
437
438   /**
439    * Returns the specified property on this bean map.
440    *
441    * <p>
442    * Allows you to get and set an individual property on a bean without having a handle to the bean itself by using
443    * the {@link BeanMapEntry#getValue()} and {@link BeanMapEntry#setValue(Object)} methods.
444    *
445    * <p>
446    * This method can also be used to get metadata on a property by calling the {@link BeanMapEntry#getMeta()} method.
447    *
448    * @param propertyName The name of the property to look up.
449    * @return The bean property, or null if the bean has no such property.
450    */
451   public BeanMapEntry getProperty(String propertyName) {
452      BeanPropertyMeta p = getPropertyMeta(propertyName);
453      if (p == null)
454         return null;
455      return new BeanMapEntry(this, p, propertyName);
456   }
457
458   /**
459    * Returns the metadata on the specified property.
460    *
461    * @param propertyName The name of the bean property.
462    * @return Metadata on the specified property, or <jk>null</jk> if that property does not exist.
463    */
464   public BeanPropertyMeta getPropertyMeta(String propertyName) {
465      return meta.getPropertyMeta(propertyName);
466   }
467
468   /**
469    * Returns the {@link ClassMeta} of the wrapped bean.
470    *
471    * @return The class type of the wrapped bean.
472    */
473   @Override /* Delegate */
474   public ClassMeta<T> getClassMeta() {
475      return this.meta.getClassMeta();
476   }
477
478   /**
479    * Extracts the specified field values from this bean and returns it as a simple Map.
480    *
481    * @param fields The fields to extract.
482    * @return
483    *    A new map with fields as key-value pairs.
484    *    <br>Note that modifying the values in this map will also modify the underlying bean.
485    */
486   public Map<String,Object> getProperties(String...fields) {
487      return new FilteredMap<>(null, this, fields);
488   }
489
490   /**
491    * Invokes all the getters on this bean and consumes the results.
492    *
493    * @param valueFilter Filter to apply to value before applying action.
494    * @param action The action to perform.
495    * @return The list of all bean property values.
496    */
497   public BeanMap<T> forEachValue(Predicate<Object> valueFilter, BeanPropertyConsumer action) {
498
499      // Normal bean.
500      if (meta.dynaProperty == null) {
501         forEachProperty(BeanPropertyMeta::canRead, bpm -> {
502            try {
503               Object val = bpm.get(this, null);
504               if (valueFilter.test(val))
505                  action.apply(bpm, bpm.getName(), val, null);
506            } catch (Error e) {
507               // Errors should always be uncaught.
508               throw e;
509            } catch (Throwable t) {
510               action.apply(bpm, bpm.getName(), null, t);
511            }
512         });
513
514      // Bean with dyna properties.
515      } else {
516         Map<String,BeanPropertyValue> actions = (meta.sortProperties ? CollectionUtils.sortedMap() : map());
517
518         forEachProperty(x -> ! x.isDyna(), bpm -> {
519            try {
520               actions.put(bpm.getName(), new BeanPropertyValue(bpm, bpm.getName(), bpm.get(this, null), null));
521            } catch (Error e) {
522               // Errors should always be uncaught.
523               throw e;
524            } catch (Throwable t) {
525               actions.put(bpm.getName(), new BeanPropertyValue(bpm, bpm.getName(), null, t));
526            }
527         });
528
529         forEachProperty(BeanPropertyMeta::isDyna, bpm -> {
530            try {
531               // TODO - This is kind of inefficient.
532               Map<String,Object> dynaMap = bpm.getDynaMap(bean);
533               if (dynaMap != null) {
534                  dynaMap.forEach((k,v) -> {
535                     Object val = bpm.get(this, k);
536                     actions.put(k, new BeanPropertyValue(bpm, k, val, null));
537                  });
538               }
539            } catch (Exception e) {
540               e.printStackTrace();
541            }
542         });
543
544         actions.forEach((k,v) -> {
545            if (valueFilter.test(v.getValue()))
546               action.apply(v.getMeta(), v.getName(), v.getValue(), v.getThrown());
547         });
548      }
549
550      return this;
551   }
552
553   /**
554    * Given a string containing variables of the form <c>"{property}"</c>, replaces those variables with property
555    * values in this bean.
556    *
557    * @param s The string containing variables.
558    * @return A new string with variables replaced, or the same string if no variables were found.
559    */
560   public String resolveVars(String s) {
561      return StringUtils.replaceVars(s, this);
562   }
563
564   /**
565    * Returns a simple collection of properties for this bean map.
566    *
567    * @return A simple collection of properties for this bean map.
568    */
569   protected Collection<BeanPropertyMeta> getProperties() {
570      return alist(meta.propertyArray);
571   }
572
573   /**
574    * Performs an action on each property in this bean map.
575    *
576    * @param filter The filter to apply to properties.
577    * @param action The action.
578    * @return This object.
579    */
580   public BeanMap<T> forEachProperty(Predicate<BeanPropertyMeta> filter, Consumer<BeanPropertyMeta> action) {
581      for (BeanPropertyMeta bpm : meta.propertyArray)
582         if (filter.test(bpm))
583            action.accept(bpm);
584      return this;
585   }
586
587   /**
588    * Returns all the properties associated with the bean.
589    *
590    * @return A new set.
591    */
592   @Override
593   public Set<Entry<String,Object>> entrySet() {
594
595      // If this bean has a dyna-property, then we need to construct the entire set before returning.
596      // Otherwise, we can create an iterator without a new data structure.
597      if (meta.dynaProperty != null) {
598         Set<Entry<String,Object>> s = set();
599         forEachProperty(x -> true, x -> {
600            if (x.isDyna()) {
601               try {
602                  x.getDynaMap(bean).entrySet().forEach(y -> s.add(new BeanMapEntry(this, x, y.getKey())));
603               } catch (Exception e) {
604                  throw new BeanRuntimeException(e);
605               }
606            } else {
607               s.add(new BeanMapEntry(this, x, x.getName()));
608            }
609         });
610         return s;
611      }
612
613      // Construct our own anonymous set to implement this function.
614      Set<Entry<String,Object>> s = new AbstractSet<>() {
615
616         // Get the list of properties from the meta object.
617         // Note that the HashMap.values() method caches results, so this collection
618         // will really only be constructed once per bean type since the underlying
619         // map never changes.
620         final Collection<BeanPropertyMeta> pSet = getProperties();
621
622         @Override /* Set */
623         public Iterator<java.util.Map.Entry<String, Object>> iterator() {
624
625            // Construct our own anonymous iterator that uses iterators against the meta.properties
626            // map to maintain position.  This prevents us from having to construct any of our own
627            // collection objects.
628            return new Iterator<>() {
629
630               final Iterator<BeanPropertyMeta> pIterator = pSet.iterator();
631
632               @Override /* Iterator */
633               public boolean hasNext() {
634                  return pIterator.hasNext();
635               }
636
637               @Override /* Iterator */
638               public Map.Entry<String, Object> next() {
639                  return new BeanMapEntry(BeanMap.this, pIterator.next(), null);
640               }
641
642               @Override /* Iterator */
643               public void remove() {
644                  throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Cannot remove item from iterator.");
645               }
646            };
647         }
648
649         @Override /* Set */
650         public int size() {
651            return pSet.size();
652         }
653      };
654
655      return s;
656   }
657
658   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
659   void setBean(Object bean) {
660      this.bean = (T)bean;
661   }
662}
